author: @manishgaurav84
text: The assumption of linearity, implies that, regression must be linear in the coefficients and not the independent variables. Eg, we can have  regression equation like , y = m1X1 + m2 X2 ^ 2 + c. This means  y is linearly related to m1, m2. but not with X1, X2 etc.  We cannot have equations like  y = m1^2X1 + m2^2X2.... So point No.1 mentioned in the video is incorrect.
